document.docAuthor: Cipola, Nikolas Gioia, Morais, José Wellington De & Bellini, Bruno Cavalcante
document.masterDocTitle: Survey of Trogolaphysa Mills (Collembola, Paronellidae) of the Brazilian Amazon including five new species and the description of the dorsal chaetotaxy of the first instar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Survey of Trogolaphysa Mills (Collembola, Paronellidae) of the Brazilian Amazon including five new species and the description of the dorsal chaetotaxy of the first instar

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Corresponding Author: nikolasgc @ gmail. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 7594 - 9574

Programa de Pós-graduação em Sistemática e Evolução, Centro de Biociências, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte. Rodovia BR 101, Lagoa Nova, Campus Universitário, 59072 - 970 Natal, RN, Brazil.

heading.emphasis:
Key to Brazilian species of
Trogolaphysa

paragraph.keyLead:
- Eyes absent; cave in São Paulo state .....................................................
T. hauseri Yoshii, 1988
3 Body with diffuse pigments or unpigmented; unguis with 3 inner teeth ( m.t. present)............................... 4

- Th II to anterior Abd III dark blue; unguis with 2 inner teeth ( m.t. absent); Rio de Janeiro state .............................................................................................
T. tijucana ( Arlé & Guimaraes, 1979 )

4 Body unpigmented; unguis b.t. subequal to m.t. and distant from each other; unguiculus acuminate; cave, São Paulo state ....................................................................................
T. aelleni Yoshii, 1988

- Body with diffuse light reddish color; unguis b.t. larger than m.t. and near to each other; unguiculus truncate; Rio de Janeiro state .................................................................................
T. millsi Arlé, 1939

- Th III with 3+3 inner mac; Rio Grande do Norte state ............................
T. formosensis Silva & Bellini, 2015
6 Body pigments restricted to antennae and coxae or on the borders of the Th II–III; head A3 mac present................ 7

- Body color pattern with specific spots at least on Abd IV ( Figs 2 , 13 , 21 , 27 ), if not then with fully pigmented head ( Fig. 8 ); head A3 mac absent ( Fig. 3D )........................................................................... 9
7 Coxae III with blue pigment; postlabial chaeta J1 present (as in Fig. 3E ); unguiculus lamella pe smooth................ 8

- Body pigment restrict to lateral border of the Th II–III, never on coxae III; postlabial chaetae J1 absent; unguiculus lamella pe serrated; Ceará state ....................................
T. ernesti Cipola & Bellini, 2017
(in
Bellini & Cipola 2017
)

8 Tibiotarsus I–III depigmented; trochanteral organ with less than 20 spine-like chaetae Santa Catarina state ..........................................................................................
T. hirtipes ( Handschin, 1924 )
*

- Tibiotarsus I–III pigmented; trochanteral organ with about 35–40 spine-like chaetae; Piauí state .........................................................................................
T. piracurucaensis Nunes & Bellini, 2018
9 Unguiculus ai lamella acuminate ( Figs 5G , 17I ); mucro with 4 teeth, il tooth simple ( Fig. 12E )...................... 10

- Unguiculus ai lamella truncate ( Fig. 30F ); mucro with 5 teeth, il tooth with 1–2 acessory denticles ( Fig. 31E ); Amazonas state ( Fig. 7 ).................................................................
T. quinquedentomucronata
sp. nov.

10 Body color pattern with bands or pigment restricted to the head, never with 1 central spot on Abd IV ( Figs 8 , 13 , 21 ); head M and S series with at least 1 mac in each series ( M4 , S5 ), Pm3 mac absent ( Figs 9D , 22F ); Th II with 2+2 or 3+3 mac on p3 complex ( Figs 10A–E ); unguis m.t. and b.t. far apart ( Figs 17H–I )............................................ 11

- Abd IV with 1 central trapezoid-shaped spot of pigment ( Fig. 2 ); head M and S series only with mic, Pm3 mac present ( Fig. 3D ); Th II with 5+5 mac on p3 complex ( Fig. 4A ); unguis m.t. next to b.t. ( Fig. 5G ); Occidental Brazilian Amazon ( Fig. 7 )...........................................................................
T. amazoccidentalensis
sp. nov.

11 Body with lateral spots or head pigmented, never with bands of pigment ( Fig. 8 , 21 ); head S3 mac absent ( Fig. 9D ); prelabral chaetae ciliate; basomedian and basolateral labial fields with all posterior chaetae ciliate, except r ( Fig. 3E ); collophore anteriorly with 3 or less distal mac ( Fig. 12A )............................................................. 12

- Body laterally with black bands ( Fig. 13 ); head S3 mac present ( Fig. 14E ); prelabral chaetae smooth ( Fig. 14D ); basomedian and basolateral labial fields with m2 , e and l1 smooth ( Fig. 15C ); collophore anteriorly with 5 distal mac ( Fig. 18A ); Brazilian Amazon ( Fig. 20 )...................................................................
T. nigrolineata
sp. nov.
